events.message: The customer filed a claim reporting a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th during evening rush hour.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report mentioning a car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the investigation of the reported vehicle accident claim.
The claim acknowledgment was sent to the customer, confirming receipt and expressing commitment to assistance.
Requested copies of the police accident report, driver's license, and vehicle registration from the claimant.
The customer submitted all requested documents including photos of the damaged vehicle and accident report.
Investigation into the collision details and liability began based on the submitted evidence and statements.
Investigation concluded confirming the claimant was not at fault in the auto accident involving their vehicle.
A settlement amount covering vehicle repairs and related expenses was proposed to the customer.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and prompt handling of their claim.
The insurance claim was officially approved following acceptance of the settlement conditions by the claimant.
Payment was issued to the customer to cover the approved settlement amount for their vehicle damages.
The claim was closed successfully after payment confirmation and final communication with the customer.
All claim records and documentation were archived in compliance with company policies and regulations.
